int CText::setColumns ( int columns )
 

The number of "M" characters that will fit in the field horizontally. The widget uses this resource only if the width component of the Pt_ARG_DIM resource is 0.

int CText::setCursorPosition ( int cursorPosition )
 

int CText::getCursorPosition ( )
 

the cursor position. A value of 0 indicates that the cursor will be placed before the first character, 1 before the second character, and so on.

int CText::setEditMask ( char * editMask )
 

A string that serves as an input filter for the text field. Each character in the string determines the acceptable input for the corresponding character position in the text field. The edit mask can contain the following:

Parameters:
X   Any character.
A   Alphabetic characters only.
Numeric   characters only.
d   Alphanumeric characters.
N   Alphanumeric characters. All alphabetic characters are converted to uppercase.
n   Alphanumeric characters. All alphabetic characters are converted to lowercase.
C   Alphabetic characters only. All alphabetic characters are converted to uppercase.
c   Alphabetic characters only. All alphabetic characters are converted to lowercase. anything else Treated as a space holder, and will appear as is without alterations in the text field. The cursor "steps over" space holders.

int CText::setMaxLength ( int maxLength )
 

the maximum length the widget will accept.

int CText::setCursorWidth ( int cursorWidth )
 

the width, in pixels, of the cursor.

int CText::isChangeActivate ( )

Pt_CHANGE_ACTIVATE   If the text is changed and the widget loses focus, invoke the Pt_CB_ACTIVATE callback with the Pt_CHANGE_ACTIVATE subtype.

Parameters:
Pt_TEXT_AUTO_HIGHLIGHT   Highlight the text when the widget is given focus. Default is off.

int CText::setHighlightBackgroundColor ( PgColor_t highlightBackgroundColor )
 

The background color for highlighting. If this is Pt_DEFAULT_COLOR, the default background color is used.

int CText::setHighlightTextColor ( PgColor_t highlightTextColor )
 

The text color for highlighting. If this is Pt_DEFAULT_COLOR, the default text color is used.

void CText::addModifyNotifyCallback ( PtCallbackF_t modifyNotifyCallbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

amA list of callbacks that the widget invokes after the value of the text
string changes. If the widget has the Pt_CALLBACKS_ACTIVE bit set in its Pt_ARG_FLAGS resource, this callback is also invoked when the text is changed by a call to PtSetResources() or to a text widget function such as PtTextModifyText().

void CText::addModifyVerifyCallback ( PtCallbackF_t modifyVerifyCallbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

amA list of callbacks that the widget invokes before the value of the text
string changes. To alter the input to the widget, you can modify the members of the callback structure. See the "Callback structure" section below or PtTextModifyText(). If the widget has the Pt_CALLBACKS_ACTIVE bit set in its Pt_ARG_FLAGS resource, this callback is also invoked when the text is changed by a call to PtSetResources() or to a text widget function such as PtTextModifyText().

void CText::addMotionNotifyCallback ( PtCallbackF_t motionNotifyCallbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

amA list of callbacks that the widget invokes after the cursor is
repositioned. If the widget has the Pt_CALLBACKS_ACTIVE bit set in its Pt_ARG_FLAGS resource, this callback is also invoked when the cursor is repositioned by a call to PtSetResources().

void CText::addMotionVerifyCallback ( PtCallbackF_t motionVerifyCallbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

amA list of callbacks that the widget invokes before the cursor is
repositioned. Using this callback resource, you can modify or even disallow cursor repositioning. If the widget has the Pt_CALLBACKS_ACTIVE bit set in its Pt_ARG_FLAGS resource, this callback is also invoked when the cursor is repositioned by a call to PtSetResources().

void CText::addTextChangedCallback ( PtCallbackF_t textChangedCallbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

amA list of callbacks that the widget invokes when the value of the text
string changes. If the widget has the Pt_CALLBACKS_ACTIVE bit set in its Pt_ARG_FLAGS resource, this callback is also invoked when the text is changed by a call to PtSetResources() or to a text widget function such as PtTextModifyText().

adds text to the end of the text buffer;

int to = -1 )
